definition: to exchange (sth) for (sth else)/to replace with/to convert into
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: It is transformed into visible light image through optical correlator.
sentences.chinese: 它通過光學相關器轉換成可見光圖像信息。

sentences.english: Smiling at the Dornish knights, she switched back to the Common Tongue.
sentences.chinese: 邊對多恩騎士微笑，她邊轉換成通用語。

sentences.english: He wanted to convert his dollars into Japanese yen.
The other professor was replaced by two teachers.
sentences.chinese: 另一個班的教授換成了兩名教師。

sentences.english: This is an open top outrigger kayak that converts into a tent with ease.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個開放前支腿皮艇可以轉換成輕鬆帳篷。

sentences.english: Just got done setting up a few new computer to send down to our Georgia facility to replace some 6 year old computers.
sentences.chinese: 把一些在喬治亞州用了六年的舊電腦換成新的。

sentences.english: I would like to change the room to a double, not single.
sentences.chinese: 我想換成雙人房，而不要單人房。

sentences.english: We substituted red balls for blue balls, to see if the baby could notice.
sentences.chinese: 我們把藍球換成了紅球以觀察嬰兒是否注意到了。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, May I have it changed the small plate?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我把它換成小盤子好嗎？

sentences.english: After the earlier invasion, Celtic had been replaced with English.
sentences.chinese: 早期的侵略後，凱爾特語被替換成英語。

sentences.english: All you have to do is simply switch the salt shaker with sugar!
sentences.chinese: 在這個惡作劇裏，你所做的僅僅是把鹽罐換成糖罐。

sentences.english: I'd some coins for this hundred yuan note.
sentences.chinese: 我想把這一百元紙幣換成硬幣。

sentences.english: Some parents do not want to make the switch for even their school-age children.
sentences.chinese: 有些家長甚至不願讓開始上學的孩子換成電子書。

sentences.english: Let me change the dollar bill for coins.
sentences.chinese: 讓我把這張美元的紙鈔換成硬幣。

sentences.english: By default, all packages are transformed to folders.
sentences.chinese: 默認條件下，所有的包都被轉換成了文件夾。

sentences.english: Next station, Hongshan Square, interchange station for the Line 2.
sentences.chinese: 下一站，洪山廣場，乘客可以換成2號線。

definition: lit. a good horse doesn't turn around and graze the same patch again (idiom)/fig. once you've moved on, don't go back again (romantic relationship, job etc)/leave the past behind
pinyin: hao3 ma3 bu4 chi1 hui2 tou2 cao3

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
melting point (of lubricating oil)
conjoined twins
to die from excessive ejaculation
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: to talk nonsense/to bullshit
see 屎蚵螂[shi3 ke1 lang2]
needlework/sewing
paper tape/ticker tape/paper streamer
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
bull terrier
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
